required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Peripheral Endothelial Function in COPD Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of a Peripheral Endothelial Dysfunction in COPD (Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease)

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to assess the peripheral endothelial function in adult COPD (chronic obstructive pulmonary disease) patients and the relationship between the peripheral endothelial function and the pulmonary function.

detailed_description.textblock: The primary criteria is the peripheral endothelial function that will be assessed by the measure of flow-mediated dilation (reactive hyperemia-peripheral artery tone index). The pulmonary function will be assessed by the measures of the FEV1 (forced expiratory volume in one second), the forced vital capacity (FVC) and the expiratory flow between 25% and 75% (FEF25-75%). The relationship between these parameters of the pulmonary function and the peripheral endothelial function will be analyzed. In addition, a relationship between peripheral endothelial function and the severity of COPD (classification according to GOLD (Global Initiative for Chronic Obstructive Lung Disease) 2010 and GOLD 2011 and the COPD assessment test, the cardiovascular risk factors (SCORE INdex) and the smoker status will be also assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: measure of reactive hyperemia-peripheral artery tone index
primary_outcome.description: measure of reactive hyperemia-peripheral artery tone index

secondary_outcome.measure: measure of Forced expiratory flow in one second
secondary_outcome.description: measure of Forced expiratory flow in one second

secondary_outcome.measure: measure of expiratory flow between 25% and 75% (FEF25-75%).
secondary_outcome.description: measure of expiratory flow between 25% and 75% (FEF25-75%).

arm_group.description: measure of endothelial function with EndoPAT® in COPD patients

intervention.description: measure of peripheral endothelial function by the reactive hyperemia-peripheral artery tone index with a specific device (EndoPAT®)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- COPD : FEV1/FVC < 70%
- Smokers or ex-smokers ( ≥ 10 pack-years)
- No COPD exacerbation in the last three months
- No history of asthma and no respiratory allergy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or nursing women
- Treatment with pulmonary vasodilators
- Patients with a significant acute disease. A significant disease is defined as a disease which, in the opinion of the investigator, may influence the results of the trial.
